text: Tropical Cyclone Seroja was a tropical cyclone that caused massive and deadly flash floods and landslides in East Timor and southern Indonesia. The twenty- second tropical low and seventh tropical cyclone of the 2020â€“21 Australian region cyclone season, formed off the south coast of Timor island as Tropical Low 22U at 18:00 UTC on 3 April 2021. The name Seroja means lotus in Indonesian. ==References== Category:April 2021 events Category:Tropical cyclones in Asia Category:2021 in weather Category:Retired tropical cyclone names
title: Cyclone Seroja
